item.title: India vs West Indies Women LIVE Cricket Score, 3rd T20I: Mandhana’s record fifty leads IND towards 100 - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs West Indies Women LIVE Cricket Score, 3rd T20I: IND set 218 target for WI; Richa Ghosh slams fastest fifty after Mandhana 77

Date: December 2024, Source: Indian Express

In a thrilling match, India Women set a record score of 217/4 against West Indies in the 3rd T20I. Richa Ghosh scored an 18-ball fifty, making it the joint-fastest in WT20Is.

  • India starts strong with Smriti Mandhana scoring a pivotal 77 runs.
  • Richa Ghosh's rapid fifty propels India to a formidable total.
  • The series is level at 1-1 after West Indies' win in the previous match.
“She wants to be the girl under pressure all the time. That’s when she’s at her best I think,” - Shane Deitz, West Indies coach.

This match sets the stage for an exciting finish in the T20I series, followed by an ODI series as part of the ICC Championship.

item.title: 'He Was Humiliated': Ravichandran Ashwin's Father Makes Stunning Claim After Legend's Retirement | Exclusiv - News18
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin's Father Claims 'Humiliation' Led to Retirement

Date: December 19, 2024
Source: CNN News18

Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement from international cricket may be linked to ongoing humiliation, according to his father, who expressed shock at his son's unexpected announcement.

  • Ashwin's father claims his son faced long-term humiliation.
  • Surprised by the sudden retirement announcement amid the Australia tour.
  • India captain Rohit Sharma stated Ashwin had been considering retirement for some time.
  • Ashwin ends his international career with 765 wickets.
  • His father supported him throughout his career, emphasizing Ashwin's own effort and intelligence.
“What was going on in his mind I don’t know. He just announced.” - Ravichandran Ashwin

The discussion around Ashwin's retirement highlights the pressures faced by athletes in high-stakes environments.

item.title: 'Virat Kohli wouldn't have let Ashwin retire mid-series': Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir lambasted over 'bad decision' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India's Ravichandran Ashwin called time on his illustrious career on Wednesday.

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Ravichandran Ashwin announced a shock retirement following the draw in the third Test in Brisbane. His unexpected decision left India without a spinner for the remaining Tests of the series in Australia.

  • Ashwin confirmed his retirement effective immediately.
  • Virat Kohli is suggested to have acted differently if he were captain.
  • Former cricketer Basit Ali criticized the decision to let Ashwin retire mid-series.
  • Ashwin is India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests with 537 wickets.
“Virat Kohli wouldn't have let Ashwin retire mid-series if he were the captain.” - Basit Ali

The retirement adds to the ongoing discussions about the management of players in crucial series. Ashwin's contributions and legacy as a 'series-winner' are highlighted despite the controversy.

item.title: ICC confirms hybrid model for Champions Trophy, India vs Pakistan matches to be played at neutral venue in 2024-27 cycle - Hindustan Times
item.description:
ICC Confirms Hybrid Model for Champions Trophy, India vs Pakistan Matches to be Held at Neutral Venue

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The ICC has announced that the Champions Trophy will be played in Pakistan and at a neutral venue, ensuring that India and Pakistan matches occur at neutral locations during the 2024-2027 cycle.

  • The 2025 Champions Trophy will feature matches held in Pakistan and at neutral venues.
  • The decision comes in response to logistical and safety concerns over India traveling to Pakistan.
  • Several upcoming tournaments, including the Women’s World Cup and Men’s T20 World Cup, will also implement neutral venue arrangements for India-Pakistan matches.
  • The tournament marks Pakistan's first hosting of the Champions Trophy since 1998.
“Neutral venue arrangements are designed to ensure smooth logistical operations and safety for all teams and fans amid the longstanding political tensions between the two cricketing giants.”

This landmark decision aims to facilitate international cricket amid ongoing geopolitical tensions and ensure fan safety during these high-stakes matches.

item.title: R Ashwin's Father's Shocking Revelation On Son's Retirement: "Humiliation..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
R Ashwin's Father's Shocking Revelation on Son's Retirement

Publication Date: Not specified Source: News 18

The recent retirement of Indian cricket star Ravichandran Ashwin has surprised his fans and family alike. His father suggested that feelings of 'humiliation' may have influenced Ashwin's sudden decision to retire from international cricket.

  • Ashwin returned home from Australia after announcing his retirement.
  • His father mentioned they were also shocked by the news.
  • There are claims that humiliation contributed to Ashwin’s decision.
  • Ashwin was one of the top wicket-takers for India in international cricket.
  • He only played in one pink-ball Test during the recent series.
“What was going on in his mind I don't know. He just announced. I too accepted it with full pleasure.” - Ashwin's father

This retirement marks a significant change after a long and successful career, leaving many to speculate about the reasons behind his quick departure from the sport.

item.title: 'You can't film without asking me': Irritated Virat Kohli on arriving at Melbourne Airport - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli Expresses Frustration with Media at Melbourne Airport

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

Indian cricketer Virat Kohli arrived in Melbourne for the Boxing Day Test and had a tense exchange with the media regarding their filming practices.

  • Kohli was irritated over perceived filming of his family at the airport.
  • A Channel 7 reporter clarified that the situation arose from a misunderstanding.
  • Kohli emphasized his need for privacy concerning his children, stating, “With my kids I need some privacy, you can’t film without asking me.”
  • The misunderstanding was resolved when it was confirmed that his children were not being filmed.
  • Kohli's recent performance has been mixed, scoring a century in the first Test but only 26 runs in his other innings.
  • The Border-Gavaskar series is tied 1-1 going into the fourth Test at the MCG.
“It was upon seeing the waiting cameras that Kohli became a little heated over what is largely a misunderstanding when he thought the media was filming him with his children,” reported Channel 7.

The incident highlights ongoing tensions between celebrities and media privacy norms.

item.title: Hybrid model agreed for Champions Trophy and ICC events from 2024-27 - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Hybrid model agreed for Champions Trophy and ICC events from 2024-27

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPNcricinfo

The ICC has reached a breakthrough in the 2025 Champions Trophy impasse, implementing a hybrid model where India's matches will take place at neutral venues, and vice versa for Pakistan.

  • All matches involving India in events hosted in Pakistan will be at neutral venues.
  • Similarly, all matches involving Pakistan in events hosted by India will also be held at neutral venues.
  • This agreement applies to multiple events, including the 2025 men's Champions Trophy and the 2025 women's ODI World Cup.
  • The neutral venue will be proposed by the tournament host board and must be approved by the ICC.
  • The ICC is open to hosting a tri-nation T20I series involving India and Pakistan at neutral venues.
The 2025 Champions Trophy is set to begin on February 19, but the tournament schedule has not yet been released due to uncertainty over the venues.

This agreement marks a significant development in international cricket relations and aims to ensure fairness for both teams during tournament play.

item.title: Virat Kohli 'leaving India'; cricketer to move to London with Anushka Sharma, kids Vamika, Akaay soon, confirms ex-coach - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli and Family Set to Relocate to London, Confirms Coach

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Rajkumar Sharma, Virat Kohli's childhood coach, has confirmed that Kohli, along with Anushka Sharma and their children, will soon be relocating to London.

  • Kohli's move is expected to be permanent post-retirement.
  • The family has been frequently spotted in London, especially since the birth of their second child, Akaay.
  • Sharma believes Kohli has more runs left in him and will continue playing for several more years.
“Virat is still very fit and not too old to retire. I believe that Virat will play cricket for five more years. He will also be seen playing in the 2027 World Cup.”

This transition marks a significant change for the cricketer as he aims to spend more time with his family and prepare for life after cricket.

item.title: Virat Kohli involved in heated argument with Australian TV journalist: 'I need privacy with my kids. You just can't...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli Involves in Tense Exchange with Australian Journalist Over Children’s Privacy

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli had a heated argument with an Australian TV journalist at Melbourne airport as he felt his children were being filmed without consent. The former captain is known for being protective of his family.

  • Kohli became upset upon realizing video cameras pointed at his children.
  • He confronted the journalist, stating, "With my kids I need some privacy, you just can't film without asking me."
  • The situation was later clarified, and Kohli shook hands with the involved cameraperson.
  • His performance has been a concern in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where he's struggled apart from a century.
“It was upon seeing the waiting cameras that Kohli became a little heated...” – Theo Doropoulos, Channel 7 Reporter

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy series is currently tied 1-1, with the next match scheduled for December 26.

item.title: Virat Kohli's Shift To London Confirmed As Childhood Coach Lifts Lid On Future Plans: 'He'll Leave India Soon' - Times Now
item.description:
Virat Kohli's Permanent Shift To London Confirmed As Childhood Coach Spills Beans On Future Plans

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Dainik Jagran

Virat Kohli is reportedly planning a move to London with his family as confirmed by his childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma. This news follows a series of speculations about Kohli's relocation during breaks between international matches.

  • Kohli's coach Rajkumar Sharma revealed that Kohli will leave India soon.
  • Kohli struggled during the recent Australia tour, but Sharma is optimistic about his performance in the upcoming matches.
  • Sharma believes Kohli has plenty of cricket left and expects him to play in the 2027 ODI World Cup.
  • Recent retirement news of R Ashwin has led to discussions about other senior players, including Kohli, but Sharma reassures that retirement is not imminent for Kohli.
“Virat is still super fit, and retirement isn’t on the cards anytime soon,” - Rajkumar Sharma

In conclusion, while speculation surrounds Virat Kohli's move and retirement, his childhood coach is confident that he still has more to contribute to cricket.

item.title: After getting out of jail at Gabba, will Indian batters feel at 'home' in Melbourne? - The Times of India
item.description:
After getting out of jail at Gabba, will Indian batters feel at 'home' in Melbourne?

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

India managed to draw the third Test against Australia at Gabba, ensuring the five-Test series remains tied at 1-1. The Indian team hopes to leverage their confidence in the upcoming matches in Melbourne and Sydney.

  • India was in a tough position at 74 for 5 chasing Australia's 445.
  • Key contributions came from KL Rahul (85) and Ravindra Jadeja (77).
  • After a rain-affected day, India avoided defeat thanks to tailenders who put up a fight.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma emphasizes the need to start fresh in Melbourne.
  • India must win both remaining matches to secure their place in the World Test Championship final.
  • Current performance of top Indian batters raises concerns, particularly Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
“Whatever happened today (last day of Brisbane Test), it gave us confidence ahead of Melbourne.” - Rohit Sharma

In conclusion, the Indian team is looking to build on their draw at Gabba while facing challenges in upcoming matches, aiming for victory to ensure their position in crucial tournament standings.

item.title: Keshav Maharaj ruled out of last two Pakistan ODIs - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Keshav Maharaj Ruled Out of Last Two Pakistan ODIs

Published on: Thu, Dec 19, 2024, 07:05 AM Source: Cricbuzz

South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj is out of the remainder of the ongoing ODI series against Pakistan at home due to a left abductor strain, which he sustained while warming up for the series opener.

  • Maharaj was named in the starting lineup but did not play due to his injury.
  • He will miss the 2nd and 3rd ODIs on December 19 and 22.
  • Bjorn Fortuin has been named as his replacement for the fixtures.
  • He is also included in the Test squad despite his injury.
  • South Africa leads the World Test Championship table with a PCT of 63.330.
  • Maharaj will return home for rehabilitation ahead of an important Test match starting on December 26.
“Keshav will return home to Durban for rehabilitation and will be assessed ahead of the first Test.”

The absence of Keshav Maharaj in the ODI series is a significant blow for the South African team, but he remains integral to their Test squad aspirations.

item.title: "By Letting R Ashwin Retire...": Harsha Bhogle's Blunt Message For Veterans Kohli, Rohit - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"By Letting R Ashwin Retire…": Harsha Bhogle's Blunt Message For Veterans Kohli, Rohit

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin's unexpected mid-series retirement has raised eyebrows in the cricketing community. Commentator Harsha Bhogle suggests this decision sets a precedent for other aging veterans in Indian cricket, urging them to consider their futures.

  • Ashwin's retirement comes as a shock during the crucial Brisbane Test against Australia.
  • Bhogle argues that Ashwin's departure signals a call for other veterans like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to reflect on their careers.
  • The selection of Washington Sundar over Ashwin indicates a shift in team priorities.
  • Bhogle's tweet highlights the implication of Ashwin's retirement for the selection process.
“By letting Ashwin retire, and he would be playing if he was picked, the selectors have set the bar for everyone else. Interesting times ahead.” — Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha)

The cricket community might see more veteran retirements resembling the mass exits in 2008, following Ashwin's departure, according to reports. The shift in focus suggests a transformative phase for Indian cricket.

Afghanistan to win the match

item.title: Virat Kohli Involved In Heated Exchange With Australian TV Journalist For Privacy Breach In Melbourne: Report - Times Now
item.description:
Virat Kohli Involved In Heated Exchange With Australian TV Journalist For Privacy Breach In Melbourne: Report

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: The West Australian

Virat Kohli reportedly engaged in a heated altercation with an Australian TV journalist in Melbourne before the Boxing Day Test. Kohli was apparently upset by cameras directed at his family, emphasizing his desire for privacy, especially concerning his children.

  • Kohli had a tense conversation with the journalist over privacy concerns.
  • He has explicitly instructed media not to photograph his children.
  • Kohli has struggled with his form in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, impacting India's performance.
  • India needs to win upcoming matches to secure a place in the WTC final.
“Kohli has mandated the Indian media to keep the cameras off his kids.”

Though Kohli's recent performance has been lacking, his contribution is crucial for India's chances in the series. A strong performance could alter the trajectory of their World Test Championship hopes.

item.title: Vinod Kambli fell in love after seeing Andrea Hewit’s poster, married for 2nd time, his love story is... - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli fell in love after seeing Andrea Hewit’s poster, married for 2nd time, his love story is...

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: India.com

In these collection of pictures, we find out all about the love story of former India cricketer Vinod Kambli and his second wife Andrea Hewit. According to reports, Kambli fell in love with Andrea after seeing her poster.

  • Vinod Kambli first saw Andrea Hewit's poster which sparked his love.
  • Kambli mentioned that he proposed to Andrea on their first meeting.
  • He was previously married to Noela Lewis until 2000.
  • They have two children together, a son named Jesus and a daughter named Johanna.
  • Andrea has been a constant support for Kambli, nursing him back to health multiple times.
  • Kambli converted to Christianity on Andrea's insistence and they remarried in a church in 2014.
  • He humorously stated that he is 'scared' of his wife, leading to him staying away from alcohol.
  • He expressed gratitude towards Sachin Tendulkar for his financial support in life.
"I made the marriage proposal to Andrea on our first meeting." - Vinod Kambli

This love story emphasizes the importance of support in relationships and showcases how love can emerge from unexpected encounters.

item.title: Behind R Ashwin's Shock Retirement, The Role Coach Gautam Gambhir Played - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Behind R Ashwin's Shock Retirement, The Role Coach Gautam Gambhir Played

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

R Ashwin's unexpected retirement announcement shocked cricket fans worldwide as he declared his exit from international cricket after the Brisbane Test, leaving many questions unanswered about his decision.

  • Ashwin expressed concerns about his role in the team and sought guarantees from selectors about being in the playing XI before traveling to Australia.
  • Following a disappointing series against New Zealand, Ashwin's mindset shifted as he faced setbacks, including being overlooked for the Perth Test in favor of Washington Sundar.
  • Despite assurances from captain Rohit Sharma, Ashwin remained third in team hierarchy, impacting his decision to retire.
  • Gautam Gambhir, the head coach, confirmed Ashwin was not the preferred choice spinner going forward.
  • At 38, Ashwin reflected on his career after 537 Test wickets, realizing he wouldn't endure through the next World Test Championship cycle.
“What doesn't change is the respect, recognition, and records R Ashwin has earned over the years.”

Ashwin's retirement marks a significant transition for the Indian cricket team, showcasing the changing dynamics and the blend of respect for a veteran's capabilities.

item.title: Sundar, Ashwin, Jadeja: How spin-bowling switcheroo possibly hastened R Ashwin's retirement - The Times of India
item.description:
Impact of Spin-Bowling Decisions on R Ashwin's Retirement

Publication Date: December 18, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement announcement has left the cricket world in shock, stemming from his exclusion in favor of other spinners during the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Ashwin was not selected for the opener at Perth, a move that likely contributed to his retirement decision.
  • Rohit Sharma's leadership return favored Ashwin's initial inclusion in the playing eleven for subsequent tests.
  • Ultimately, Ashwin’s non-selection in Brisbane prompted his early departure from the series.
  • Speculation surrounds the reasons for his sudden retirement, with hints that he had considered it for several months.
“If I am not needed right now in the series, then I am better off saying goodbye to the game.” - Rohit Sharma

The circumstances leading to Ashwin's retirement raise questions about team strategy and player dynamics, leaving fans eager for clarity regarding his decision.

item.title: 'India's greatest fast bowler': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: 'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
item.description:
'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah, recognized as one of cricket's premier fast bowlers, recently surpassed Kapil Dev's record to become India's top Test wicket-taker in Australia.

  • Bumrah has overcome significant back issues to excel in cricket, achieving a record of 53 wickets in Australia.
  • He was the player of the match in India's first Test victory in Perth, claiming nine wickets in total.
  • His average of 10.90 makes him the standout bowler of the series, well ahead of his Australian counterparts.
  • Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting praised Bumrah, calling him India's greatest fast bowler across all formats.
  • Travis Head noted Bumrah's potential to be one of the greatest fast bowlers ever.
  • Despite questions regarding the legality of his bowling action, legends like Greg Chappell have defended him.
  • Bumrah's unique bowling technique has consistently troubled batters and earned admiration from players around the world.
“He is definitely India’s greatest fast bowler.” - Ricky Ponting
“Jasprit is probably going to go down as one of the greatest fast bowlers to play the game.” - Travis Head

Bumrah's remarkable achievements and comeback after injury solidify his legacy as a key player in Indian cricket history.

item.title: D Gukesh’s brilliant chess moves turned into mesmerising ‘chessnatyam’ by dynamic dancers. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
D Gukesh’s Brilliant Chess Moves Transformed into Mesmerizing Dance

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Following D Gukesh’s historic victory over Ding Liren in the World Chess Championship, two women paid tribute by transforming his winning chess moves into an elegant dance routine, captivating audiences online.

  • D Gukesh defeated Ding Liren to become the youngest world chess champion at 18.
  • A tribute video featuring dancers Anushka Chandak and Maitreyee Nirgun went viral.
  • The dance is humorously termed “chessnatyam,” a blend of chess and Bharatnatyam.
  • Social media users praised the creativity and effort put into the video.
  • Comments highlighted the performance's expression, creativity, and dedication to D Gukesh’s achievement.
“We are so so proud of you D Gukesh. India gets a second World Champion.”

The tribute reflects the joy and creativity stemming from D Gukesh's achievements, illuminating the intersection of sports and cultural expression.

item.title: Watch: Virat Kohli Overrules Rohit Sharma In Plan To Dismiss Travis Head. It Works A Treat - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Virat Kohli Overrules Rohit Sharma In Plan To Dismiss Travis Head. It Works A Treat

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

In the second innings of the third Test in Brisbane, Virat Kohli and Mohammed Siraj devised a successful strategy to dismiss Travis Head, who had scored impressively in the first innings. Kohli urged Rohit Sharma to follow his plan, which ultimately led to Head's wicket.

  • Travis Head scored a stunning 152 in the first innings, making him difficult to dismiss.
  • Kohli's strategy involved Siraj bowling from over the wicket, despite Rohit’s initial concerns.
  • The plan succeeded as Head was dismissed for only 17 runs, contributing to Australia’s poor second innings.
  • This dismissal ended Head's remarkable run of scores against India.
“No, no. Let him bowl from over the wicket. There's a chance of getting him out with the scrambled seam.” - Virat Kohli

Kohli's tactical intervention not only showcased his cricketing intellect but also highlighted the importance of collaboration and strategy in cricket, ultimately ensuring a critical advantage for India in the match.

item.title: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma Contradict On Ashwin's Retirement Plan, Confusion Erupts - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Uncertain Future, Knee Struggle, Family's Advice: Behind R Ashwin's Last-Minute Retirement Call - NDTV Sports
item.description:
R Ashwin's Surprising Retirement During Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: March 9, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin has made the unexpected decision to retire during the 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy, citing knee issues and uncertainty about his future with the Indian Test team as key factors.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement at age 38, after playing 106 Tests and taking 537 wickets.
  • His decision was influenced by persistent knee problems and lack of consistent selection.
  • Ashwin informed his family of his retirement decision the night before, which came as a shock to many teammates.
  • His last match was against Australia in Adelaide, where he took one wicket in the pink-ball Test.
“Ashwin's injury struggles and his non-selection in overseas conditions contributed to this abrupt decision.”

This retirement marks the end of an illustrious career for one of India's leading spinners, leaving many to reflect on his significant contributions to the game.
